thread.title: Dara O'Briain, JK Rowling and Bake Off's Tamal Ray show support for junior doctors' protest
thread.title_full: Dara O'Briain, JK Rowling and Bake Off's Tamal Ray show support for junior doctors' protest

title: Dara O'Briain, JK Rowling and Bake Off's Tamal Ray show support for junior doctors' protest
text:
Dara O'Briain, JK Rowling and Bake Off's Tamal Ray show support for junior doctors' protest Dara O'Briain, JK Rowling and Bake Off's Tamal Ray show support for junior doctors' protest 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Thousands of doctors are set to take to the streets of London to protest over the government’s plans to impose a new contract for doctors. 
The demonstration is part of an ongoing row between Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt and representatives from the British Medical Association. View from the stage at the junior doctors protest in Waterloo Place #notsafenotfair pic.twitter.com/B0z7vopSzk 
— Becky Barnes (@BeckyBarnesB) October 17, 2015 
Those who oppose the contract claim it could mean pay cuts of up to 30%, with a reclassification of “normal hours” to 7am to 10pm, Monday to Saturday, as opposed to the current arrangement of 7am to 7pm Monday to Friday. 
Plenty of NHS workers are backing the march on Twitter, but they’re not the only ones sharing 140 characters of support. A number of famous faces also showed some love via Twitter. 
Comedian Dara O’Briain cheered on protesters on his Twitter account. Good luck to the junior doctors marching today! 
— Dara Ó Briain (@daraobriain) October 17, 2015 
Ralf Little said a big thank you to the workforce keeping us in good health, and wished them the best of luck. Good luck on the march today junior doctors. Thanks for everything you have done, and will do, to look after us. #notsafenotfair 
— Ralf Little (@RalfLittle) October 17, 2015 
Writer and funnyman David Schneider tweeted support for the cause, also raising the question of exactly where Hunt expected these reforms to go. Wishing all the best to the #juniordoctors demonstrating today to keep us safe and well. #bump 
— David Schneider (@davidschneider) October 17, 2015 Hunt clearly plans to replace NHS with academy/free hospitals that can use unqualified doctors. It's the only explanation #juniorcontract 
— David Schneider (@davidschneider) October 17, 2015 
The Great British Bake Off’s runner up Tamal Ray, who is a trainee anaesthetist first and an avid baker second, sent some positive vibes to his fellow medical professionals. Good luck to all marching today in London, fighting against the unsafe new #juniorcontract for #juniordoctors . 
— TAMAL RAY (@DrRayBakes) October 17, 2015 
Activist and musician Billy Bragg chimed in with a supportive tweet for all those marching. Solidarity with junior doctors marching in London today. #savetheNHS #juniorcontract pic.twitter.com/PuaPsvOBDf 
— Billy Bragg (@billybragg) October 17, 2015 
Meanwhile author JK Rowling took to Twitter to announce that she stood with the junior docs’ protest. Standing with the #juniordoctors protesting the Tories' #juniorcontract today! 
— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) October 17, 2015 
Embarrassing Bodies’ resident expert Dr Christian Jessen showed some love for his fellow docs. To #juniordoctors marching today: we who went before you didn't have the balls to call for change. You do. Make sure you do it! Good luck x Share article 
— Dr Christian Jessen (@DoctorChristian) October 17, 2015 Promoted Stories
